column4: I've been using Ubuntu for four years now. I absolutely HATE the new layout! I don't mind change, but this is ridiculous. I know how to change it after an install, but during a Live CD session I find myself on an Easter egg hunt just to find everything! If someone can tell me how to use Classic Ubuntu from Live CD I would appreciate it.
in GDM choose Gnome Classic
you could also install the Gnome3 PPA.. Gnome3 is niceee
but I have to logout to do that right?
sure
I tried that.
select your username in GDM, then below, change the session
no reason why it would not work...
oh, you have installed Ubuntu 11.04 or you are running it live ?
I am going to try again. BTW.. I didn't know about Gnome3. How do I install that?
one sec let me find you the PPA info
I'm running off of Live CD
ah ok ... mmm well certainly if you have installed it, you can switch to Classic Gnome
have no idea if it would work on LiveCD
I know, I'm doing that on my PC. I'll have to just deal with it for a little bit.
http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2011/04/gnome-3-released-to-be-available-for-ubuntu-11-04-via-ppa/
Thank you! YOU ROCK!!
beware ! The PPA is not stable ... if you can, I would install 11.04 as normal, then just change the session to Classic
but I am certainly looking forward to Gnome 3 in the future release of Ubuntu (hopefully they will include it)
OK, I will install it on my "test" laptop
Thank you so much for your help!!
your welcome, good luck
